string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns10111011101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

terms.term: An unwanted or bad response to a medication
An abnormal response of the body’s immune system to a medication
A very dangerous allergic reaction that can affect the whole body, causing difficulty breathing, hives, and changes in blood pressure
A medication made by a specific pharmaceutical company
These are prescription medications that require special storage and tracking
The response or result expected from a medication; therapeutic effect
A medication called by its chemical name; a generic medication has the same chemicals as a brand- name medication
These are natural substances that you can buy without a prescription
The intended use of the medication
A specific resource that contains information about medications a person is taking
A change in the effect of a medication when it is given at about the same time as another medication
Is how a person responds to a medication or other substance
Is no response to a medication; lack of the response expected from a medication
These are the medications you can buy without a prescription; over-the-counter medications
These are medications you can buy without a prescription
A response to medications that is the opposite of what is expected
These are medications for which you must present a prescription from the HCP to the pharmacy in order to buy
An unwanted or unintended response to a medication
The response or result expected from a medication; the desired or beneficial effect
A condition in which the body stores up more of a medication than it can handle or does not process the medication properly
An unplanned and undesired response to a medication, including allergic reactions, side effects, paradoxical effects, etc.
